body:
Framework unit tests are currently run prior to all other tests.

This PR enables execution of the test framework unit tests in parallel with the functional tests, rather than before the functional tests, saving runtime and more efficiently using available cores.

### New behavior:
1) When running all tests, the framework unit tests are run in parallel with the other tests (unless explicitly skipped with `--skipunit` or `--exclude`).  This parallelization introduces marginal time savings when running all tests, depending on the machine used.  As an example, a 2-3% time savings (9 seconds) was observed on a machine using `--jobs=18` (with 18 available cores).
2) When running specific functional tests, framework unit tests are now skipped by default (equivalent to using `--skipunit`).  Framework unit tests can be added by including `feature_framework_unit_tests.py` in the list of specific tests being executed.  The rationale for skipping by default is that if the tester is running specific functional tests, there is a conscious decision to focus testing, and choosing to run all tests (where unit tests are run by default) would be a next step.

### Implementation notes:
Since `TextTestRunner` can be noisy (even with verbosity=0, and therefore trigger job failure through the presence of non-failure stderr output), the approach taken was to capture the output of the unit tests, and forward this output along if a test failure occurred (as determined by `TestResult` returned).  This aligns with the previous check for unit test failure (`if not result.wasSuccessful():`).  

This approach was tested by inserting `self.assertEquals(True, False)` into test_framework/segwit_addr.py:test_segwit_encode_decode() and seeing specifics of the failure reported.

```
150/302 - feature_framework_unit_tests.py failed, Duration: 9 s

stdout:


stderr:
....................F
======================================================================
FAIL: test_segwit_encode_decode (test_framework.segwit_addr.TestFrameworkScript.test_segwit_encode_decode)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/dev/myrepos/bitcoin/test/functional/test_framework/segwit_addr.py", line 142, in test_segwit_encode_decode
    self.assertEqual(True, False)
AssertionError: True != False

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 21 tests in 9.188s

FAILED (failures=1)
```

There was an initial thought to parallelize the execution of the unit tests themselves (i.e. run the 12 unit test files in parallel), however, this is not anticipated to further reduce runtime meaningfully and is anticipated to add unnecessary complexity.
title: test: Run framework unit tests in parallel
